review: After almost a month of use, we really like the Fire TV Stick. It was super easy to install and connect to our WiFi network. We are using it on a 1 year old Samsung tv with a standard home network, nothing unusual or fancy. We have changed WiFi routers and passwords once since installing the Fire Stick and resetting the stick took less than 3 minutes and it had no problems at all. The remote works fine and we've installed the remote control app on my Fire Phone and two Fire HDX tablets and that is working well. I actually prefer the app from my tablet to the physical remote control, my husband feels the physical remote is easier, so each to his own.The videos are clear, the ASAP is very nice and we have had instant play back on almost every Prime movie & tv show we've watched - no buffering like on our previous Sony streaming box. The mirror cast works perfectly from the Fire HDX tablets as well. I love that we can use the Fire Stick for slide shows of our photos and our own videos from the Cloud - no need to boot up the computer, dig through files on the hard drive and drag out USB cables or thumb drives!We don't have a Netflix account - no need with Prime streaming and cable - Netflix is just redundant for us. But the other apps and a few games all work well and we may end up buying the game controller at some point. Glad I bought this and I will probably get a second one for traveling in the future.

review: As soon as they add the ability to log on to hotel wifi, they earn the other star.  I bought this for my overnighter to use with hotel wifi (replacing a product for the "G" company).  It is way better.  It is not dependent on my laptop or iPad to get online and with the benefit of their App store, I was able to add Airplay compatibility to connect with my iPhone and MacBook. The device is as fast as my Apple TV and certainly a fraction of the size.
